pull.title: Move GetTempPath() to testutil
pull.body:
Addresses https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6702 and https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/6701.

This pull request creates a new source file for test utils, and moves GetTempPath() from util to testutil.

This is because per the above issues, GetTempPath() is insecure and has unchecked error conditions, making it unsuitable for use in production code. GetTempPath() is only used in the unit tests and not used anywhere in the main code, so it would be a good idea to move this to the test suite so that no one tries to use this in the future and it's not mixed with production code.

events.message: Add a source file for unit test utils.

events.body: Fixed Windows build error. The build passes now.

issue.title: GetTempPath has unchecked error conditions
issue.body: GetTempPath can fail, but its callers do not (all?) check for this failure.

issue.title: GetTempPath is insecure
issue.body:
A number of standards (C89, POSIX, etc) had similar functions and people quickly learned it is not secure to generate temporary filenames until they are confirmed created (not merely opened). For example, an attacker may create symlinks in a race pointing to an arbitrary file the user owns that he wishes to corrupt. Boost may guarantee a unique filename, but there is a split-second before we open that file for an attacker to set up a link.

This was fixed by mkstemp which ensures the file is newly created securely. We should do something similar.

issue.title: Util ports
issue.body:
Misc PRs from Core related to util.cpp/util.h

https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6164 - Allow user to use -debug=1 to enable all debugging
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6361 - Use real number of cores for default -par, ignore virtual cores
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6149 - Buffer log messages and explicitly open logs
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6438 - openssl: avoid config file load/race
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6284 - Fix argument parsing oddity with -noX
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/6742 - Changed logging to make -logtimestamps to work also for -printtoconsole
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7114 - util: Don't set strMiscWarning on every exception
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/7667 - Move GetTempPath() to testutil
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8000 - tinyformat: force USE_VARIADIC_TEMPLATES
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8011 - don't run ThreadMessageHandler at lowered priority
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8123 - Use std::atomic for fRequestShutdown and fReopenDebugLog

issue.title: Lightweight abstraction of boost::filesystem
issue.body:
This is a refactor backport ahead of replacing most of our Boost dependencies with C++17 code.

Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7667
  - Removes merge conflicts.
- bitcoin/bitcoin#9902
- bitcoin/bitcoin@2300a5e13a8e283a21a89064827cb9e0228f1e54
- bitcoin/bitcoin#10546
  - Only the changes to `src/fs.cpp`

labels.name: C-upstream-port
labels.description: Category: Changes that are ported from the Bitcoin Core codebase.

labels.name: C-cleanup
labels.description: Category: PRs that clean code up or issues documenting cleanup.
